ygData.subject: RE: best grouping
ygData.msgSnippet: The best group I have eer been in was one consiting of 2tanks (2 true warriors) 2healers (cleric/druid) 2nukers (enchanter/wizard) We were all level 24 to 26
ygData.messageBody:
The best group I have eer been in was one consiting of
2tanks (2 true warriors)
2healers (cleric/druid)
2nukers (enchanter/wizard)
We were all level 24 to 26 playing in Cazic Thule. A well balanced group
can take multiple reds/yellow/blues/greens. The best thing about this kind
of group is the tanks can distribute tha damage very well between them
(providing they know what they are doing.) And their is a cleric to help
tank as well. The clerics would alternate acting as a 3rd tank while one
would just sit back heal/dd. When he was out of mana, that cleric would
take the place of the first tanking and then he would take over as healer.
the mages.. Well they just blew things up efficiently. Rarely did we (the
warriors) have to try to pull something off the nukers cause they burned to
fast. Its a good feeling to get 3 levels in 2 days with this kind of group
WITHOUT powerleveling or being lame. The bottom line was downtime was VERY
minimal and we could take very large groups of critters NON-stop. As for
grouping with the Enchanters... You havent played a group until you group
with higher level enchanters. Their debuff/charms are simply INCREDIBLE.
If I were to pull absolutely too many mobs, he would just charm one and turn
it from 10vs6 to 9vs7. As well as slow up the attackers so they are acting
half as fast. Less attacks equals less damage to tanks equals less mana
used by clerics equals more life for the tanks equals more damage they can
inflict equals less mana used by the mages. Sorry for the run on sentance,
but you get the picture.

Hope this helps you a bit.

Dyvim Kincaid
Warrior of Cazic Thule.


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Trent Carroll [mailto:trent@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, July 20, 1999 8:59 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: [warriors_eq] best grouping
>
>
> From: "Trent Carroll" <trent@...>
>
> In your experience what has been the best group make-up that you
> have been a
> part of? If possible give a little input on why it was the best group
> make-up. I'm concerned here with character classes, not level.
> Interested
> in group sizes anywhere between 2 and 6. Of particular interest to me is
> what it's like to group with an enchanter.
>
> I've mostly played in very small groups. I usually play with one other
> person in my group. A cleric was nice to group with in the
> pre-teens since
> he did comparable melee damage and could keep me healed up. In
> the teens I
> began grouping with a magician. He used a water elemental for a pet which
> is supposed to be about the equivalent of an equal level troll warrior. I
> would let the elemental tank for me and I would stand at that perfect
> distance where the mob attacks the elemental and not me, yet I could still
> get my hits in. Since the elemental regains HP at about 10
> points per round
> as opposed to my two it meant less down time. At level 12 the
> magician had
> a DD spell that did 90+ damage, very nice when it was needed to finish
> something off quick. He could also summon bandages so I get healed up to
> 50% for free. As a two man team the magician was much better than the
> cleric because we could dish out much more damage in less time,
> and with the
> pet taking much of the damage healing was not really necessary.
> As an added
> bonus the pet could play the part of sacrificial lamb while we zoned when
> things got nasty.
>
> Kindrael
>
>
